Description: Pale-red pottery ostracon, from the body of a large convex vessel, both interior and exterior grooved, with remains of twelve lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, smudges of unidentified black substance over one corner of interior.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.79, pl.59)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82724) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82724)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 59:2 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
